section.name: Groups
section.p:
You can create groups, each group useing a groupId prefix for its name.
This groupId translates to the path prefix of stored artifacts, and is used to determine the effective permissions when referring to a repository path.

For each group you can assign users to 3 types of roles:
Deployers - can deploy/remove (undeploy) artifacts.
Viewers - can download artifacts (simple browsing is still enabled for anyone), unless a repository has the <anonDownloadsAllowed> flag set to true (the default), then anyone can download regardless of whether or not he is a viewer of a group of an artifact in the repository.
Admins - currently unimplemented (will be used to allow management of users within a group in the next version).

section.name: Users
section.p: A defined user can either be a simple user or an "admin" user (similar to a root user). When a user is defined as an admin he automatically has all 3 roles for any group (including undefined groups).

section.name: Sample Use Case
section.p:
Suppose you need to deploy an artifact with a groupId of "org.apache.maven". You will need to create a group with any of the following names (prefixes): "org", "org.apache" or "org.apache.maven".
Then you assign appropriate users as deployers of this group.

For authenticating via Maven, you need to have similar configuration in your settings.xml:
<servers> <server> <id>repository-name-used-in-the-pom-to-refer-to-artifactory</id> <username>myUsername</username> <password>myPassword</password> </server> </servers>
